IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO MAKE THE GREATER PHILADELPHIA AREA A GREAT PLACE TO DO GOOD BUSINESS, BY FOSTERING COOPERATION AND GROWTH.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE FOR GREATER PHILADELPHIA (THE CHAMBER) BRINGS AREA BUSINESSES AND CIVIC LEADERS TOGETHER TO PROMOTE GROWTH AND CREATE OPPORTUNITY IN OUR REGION. OUR MEMBERS REPRESENT ELEVEN COUNTIES, THREE STATES, AND ROUGHLY 600,000 EMPLOYEES FROM THOUSANDS OF MEMBER COMPANIES AND ORGANIZATIONS. BY BRINGING ALL KINDS OF BUSINESSES AND LEADERS TO THE TABLE - NEW, ESTABLISHED, BIG, SMALL, GROWING, THRIVING, PERENNIAL, INNOVATIVE, AND EXPERIMENTAL - WE BUILD COMMUNITY AND FIND COMMONALITIES AMONG US ALL. WE ADVOCATE FOR REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT, BUSINESS-FRIENDLY PUBLIC POLICIES, AND ECONOMIC PROSPERITY. WE SUPPORT OUR MEMBERS WITH PRACTICAL, INSPIRING PROGRAMS, RESOURCES AND EVENTS. ALL THAT WE DO SERVES ONE CLEAR, BOLD GOAL: TO MAKE GREATER PHILADELPHIA A GREAT PLACE FOR GOOD BUSINESS.
IRS990.Desc: PROGRAMS AND EVENTS: THE CHAMBER HOSTS ANNUAL, QUARTERLY AND MONTHLY PROGRAMS RANGING FROM EDUCATIONAL SEMINARS AND NETWORKING SESSIONS TO LOCAL AND CIVIC EVENTS. THESE PROGRAMS AND EVENTS PROVIDE OUR MEMBERS NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND REGIONAL EXPOSURE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ADVOCACY: THE CHAMBER PROVIDES MEMBERS WITH A DIRECT CONNECTION TO LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS AND POLICY-MAKERS. OUR ADVOCACY TEAM WORKS ON BEHALF OF MEMBERS TO PROMOTE PUBLIC POLICY THAT WILL BOLSTER THE REGION'S ECONOMY AND IMPROVE OUR COMPETITIVENESS ON A NATIONAL AND GLOBAL SCALE. IN ADDITION, WE ARE A COMMUNITY PARTNER AND CREATE BROAD-BASED COALITIONS AROUND ISSUES THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO THE REGION'S BUSINESS COMMUNITY, INCLUDING TRANSPORTATION, INFRASTRUCTURE, EDUCATION AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: REGIONAL GROWTH INITIATIVES: THE CEO COUNCIL FOR GROWTH (CEO COUNCIL) LEADS THE REGION FORWARD BY ENVISIONING A STRONGER, MORE COMPETITIVE COMMUNITY, CONVENING DECISION MAKERS, TAKING ACTION, AND ADVOCATING FOR POLICIES AND PRACTICES THAT STRENGTHEN OUR REGIONAL ECONOMY. THE CEO COUNCIL ADVOCATES THROUGH ITS MEMBERS AND ENGAGED STAKEHOLDERS TO ENHANCE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND PROSPERITY IN THE REGION. WE PRIORITIZE THE REVITALIZATION AND ENHANCEMENT OF OUR REGION'S TALENT, MOBILITY, AND INNOVATION.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.PersonNm: DR BRUCE A MEYER MD MBA

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAMBER QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER THE EXISTING PROVISIONS OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND THEIR INCOME IS NOT SUBJECT TO STATE OR FEDERAL INCOME TAXES. THE CHAMBER FILES FEDERAL FORM 990 AND, WHEN NECESSARY, FORM 990T. FOR ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES, THE CHAMBER PROVIDES INCOME TAX LIABILITIES USING ESTABLISHED FEDERAL INCOME TAX RATES OF FOR-PROFIT CORPORATIONS. THE CHAMBER BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO U.S. FEDERAL, STATE OR LOCAL INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2019. IT IS DIFFICULT TO PREDICT THE FINAL TIMING AND RESOLUTION OF ANY PARTICULAR TAX POSITION. BASED ON THE CHAMBER'S ASSESSMENT OF MANY FACTORS, INCLUDING PAST EXPERIENCE AND JUDGMENTS ABOUT FUTURE EVENTS, THE CHAMBER DOES NOT CURRENTLY ANTICIPATE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN ITS TAX POSITIONS OVER THE NEXT 12 MONTHS.
THE BENEFIT WAS PROVIDED PURSUANT TO AN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT. THE EXECUTIVE PROVIDED DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THE REIMBURSEMENT.
THE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE FOR GREATER PHILDELPHIA CONTRIBUTED $30,350 TO A 457(F) PLAN FOR ROBERT C. WONDERLING, PRESIDENT AND CEO.
FOR ANDREA R. ALLON AND DAVID R. HEPBURN, THESE AMOUNTS INCLUDE PAYMENT OF AWARDS MADE AND DEFERRED IN PRIOR YEARS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DIRECTOR MADELINE BELL SERVES AS A BOARD MEMBER OF COMCAST. DIRECTOR BRET PERKINS IS SENIOR EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT FOR COMCAST. DIRECTOR SHARMAIN MATLOCK-TURNER SERVES AS A MEMBER OF THE IBC REGIONAL ADVISORY BOARD AND BUSINESS AFFAIRS COMMITTEE WHERE DIRECTOR GREGORY DEAVENS IS PRESIDENT AND CEO, AS WELL AS A MEMBER OF THE PECO BOARD OF DIRECTORS WHERE DIRECTOR MICHAEL INNOCENZO IS PRESIDENT AND CEO. DIRECTOR DANIEL FITZPATRICK IS A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF URBAN AFFAIRS COALITION WHERE DIRECTOR SHARMAIN MATLOCK-TURNER IS PRESIDENT AND CEO. DIRECTOR PEDRO RAMOS SERVES AS A DIRECTOR OF INDEPENDENCE HEALTH GROUP WHERE DIRECTOR GREGORY DEAVENS IS THE CEO AS WELL AS A DIRECTOR OF FS ENERGY AND POWER FUND (AN AFFILIATE OF FS INVESTMENTS). DIRECTOR MICHAEL GERBER IS AN EXECUTIVE AT FS INVESTMENTS. DIRECTOR WILLIAM HANKOWSKY SERVES ON THE BOARD OF CITIZENS FINANCIAL GROUP, WHERE DIRECTOR DANIEL FITZPATRICK IS AN EXECUTIVE. MR. HANKOWSKY ALSO SERVES ON THE BOARD OF THE PHILADELPHIA FOUNDATION WHERE DIRECTOR PEDRO RAMOS IS PRESIDENT AND CEO. DIRECTORS CHRISTOPHER FRANKLIN AND MICHAEL GERBER SERVE ON THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA WHERE DIRECTOR CRAIG CARNAROLI IS AN EXECUTIVE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY MANAGEMENT AND REVIEWED BY THE CHAMBER'S EXTERNAL ACCOUNTING FIRM. A MEETING OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE WAS HELD TO REVIEW THE DRAFT FORM 990. THE FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO THE ENTIRE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, THE CHAMBER'S GOVERNING BODY, PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAMBER'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND QUESTIONNAIRE IS ADMINISTERED TO ALL MEMBERS OF ITS EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, THE GOVERNING BODY, EACH YEAR. THE POLICY AND QUESTIONNAIRE REQUIRES EACH EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBER TO DISCLOSE CERTAIN BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS OR FAMILY RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBER AND ANOTHER EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBER OR BETWEEN THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBER AND AN OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEE OF THE CHAMBER. IT ALSO REQUIRES EACH MEMBER TO DISCLOSE IF THEY OR THEIR FAMILY MEMBER ARE A DIRECTOR, OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEE OF AN ORGANIZATION WITH WHICH THE CHAMBER CONDUCTED IN EXCESS OF $100,000 OF BUSINESS DURING THE YEAR, TO DISCLOSE ANY FAMILY MEMBER THAT RECEIVES ANY COMPENSATION, PERQUISITES OR BENEFITS FROM THE CHAMBER AND TO REPORT ANY ALLEGIANCE OR FINANCIAL INTEREST THAT THEY OR ANY FAMILY MEMBER HAS THAT MIGHT PRESENT A CONFLICT OR APPEAR TO COMPETE WITH THE DISCHARGE OF THEIR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES TO THE CHAMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAMBER HAS AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF FIVE INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF ITS EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSEEING THE DETERMINATION OF THE COMPENSATION, BENEFITS AND OTHER REMUNERATION OF THE CHAMBER'S CEO AND THE CHAMBER'S OTHER SENIOR OFFICERS. THIS COMMITTEE DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO AND REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE COMPENSATION OF THE OTHER SENIOR OFFICERS RECOMMENDED BY THE CEO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NO DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: GREATER PHILA ALLIANCE FOR CAPITAL & TECHNOLOGIES
